fields.headline: UCI Road World Championships schedule
fields.bodyText: Tuesday Women's time trial 1pm BST British interest Emma Pooley, Julia Shaw Emma Pooley defends the title she won last year on a course that seems less suited to her climbing talents than that of last year. Judith Arndt of Germany is a perennial threat Also … Junior men's time trial 8.30am Wednesday Men's time trial 11.30am British interest Bradley Wiggins, David Millar Fabian Cancellara of Switzerland is hunting a fifth world title in six years, with the German Tony Martin and the Britons Wiggins and Millar among the other likely contenders Thursday No races Friday Junior women's road race 8.30am U23 men's road race 12pm Saturday Women's road race 12.30pm British interest Emma Pooley, Lizzie Armitstead, Katie Colclough, Nicole Cooke, Catherine Williamson, Sharon Laws, Lucy Martin Intriguingly open, with the Netherland's Marianne Vos the big name to watch. The 140km course, comprising 10 laps of a 14km circuit, may be too flat for Pooley but should suit Yorkshire's Armitstead, while the form of Cooke, the Welsh winner of the 2008 Olympic and world road race titles, is an enigma Also … Junior men's road race 8am Sunday Men's road race 9am British interest Mark Cavendish, Steve Cummings, Chris Froome, Jeremy Hunt, David Millar, Ian Stannard, Geraint Thomas, Bradley Wiggins Mark Cavendish is among the favourites to win the rainbow jersey, but the name topping most predictions will be Philippe Gilbert of Belgium, winner this year of 17 races including four major one-day classics. The 266km course will also suit the defending champion, Thor Hushovd
